tooltips.goToSettingsToChangeEditingPermission: Please Click This To Change Editing Permission

collectionPage.searchHint: Please use keywords. Press enter to search.

settings.cardsDisplayedNum: Number of Search Results in Each Page
settings.Show Control Unit Extra Control Guide: Show Control Unit Extra Control Guide

notify.editorEntry: Use {...} button to view graph details and more!
notify.Please click the lock on the top right o: Please click the lock on the top right of the editor to enable editing

license.licenseInfo1: All the articles without special specification are licensed under a

account.noNewAccount: We don't accept new accounts for now.

dialog.mobileWarning: We believe coding on a phone is a torture, so the mobile view is not perfected. Please use a larger screen to get the full experience

graph.You can also edit this in the Settings p: You can also edit this in the Settings page

ui.tutorial intro: This is going to guide you through how graphery tutorial works
ui.graph intro: This is going to guide you through how graphery graph playground works
ui.tutorial section: This is the text description of the tutorial
ui.graph section: This is the visualization window on this specific graph
ui.editor section: This is the code editor where you can see code execution process and write your own
ui.variable list section: This is the variable list where changes made to traced variables are shown
ui.control unit: This is where you can control code execution

graph window.choose graphs: You can click here to choose available graphs
graph window.drag node and view port: You can drag the nodes and adjust the viewport
graph window.lasso tool: You can press shift and mouse drag to use the lasso tool

control unit.forward button: Click this to move execution forward
control unit.step control group: Click these buttons to move code execution steps
control unit.slider: Drag the slider to jump to a specific step
control unit.edit lock: Click this to open start editing the code and see more control options

product guide.before exit: Do you want to exit the guide?
product guide.show intro again: Do you want to see the intro again next time?
